info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 3:08AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Elevated Fire Weather Danger Predicted Today... A very dry air mass over the area will combine with dead and dry fuels such as grass, leaves, and twigs to create the potential for uncontrolled fire spread across northern Maine today. This afternoon, the relative humidity will decrease to between 20 and 30 percent. A west to southwest wind is expected to increase to 10 to 15 mph this afternoon with a few gusts to 20 mph. The wind is expected to diminish and become light and variable around sunset this evening with good relative humidity recovery by late tonight. Extra caution should be taken to prevent wildfires. Always consult with fire officials before engaging in any open burning activities and comply with all applicable laws and regulations. Never leave an open fire unattended and always extinguish campfires completely before leaving.
